snippet: The meningitis outbreak points to a disturbing lack of regulatory oversight of pharmacies that mix drug compounds and ship them around the country.
abstract: Editorial contends meningitis outbreak linked to steroid produced by New England Compounding Center has laid bare disturbing lack of regulatory oversight of pharmacies that mix drug compounds; urges Congress to pass legislation to strengthen Food an Drug Administration to minimize risk of such contaminated products.
lead_paragraph: The meningitis outbreak points to a disturbing lack of regulatory oversight of pharmacies that mix drug compounds and ship them around the country.
